metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3616 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The cjpeg utility in libjpeg allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) or execute arbitrary code via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
libturbojpeg - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only affects the cjpeg tool, which isn't shipped in libjpeg6b

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1').
